website_summaries.verdict: An engaging lower-elementary geography book with one quirk: activity pages should be copied for use, or else you may cut out part of the next day's lesson.
pros: Covers continents and oceans, map skills, and basic land forms
Written in accordance with national geography standards
cons: Some cutting/gluing pages are awkward for home use, since the book was originally written for classroom use and photocopied materials

customer_reviews.title: Layout just doesn't make sense. What were they thinking?
customer_reviews.text: Content is great but layout is horrible. There are allot of cut and paste activities, which is great, but these very pages are printed on top of each other. Either you are cutting one side of a page to then paste it into the back of the very page you cut OR you're cutting a page with valuable information on one side that'll be lost by the pictures you need on the other side of said page (hopefully my pictures convey my point). I gave it two stars, and not one, because it IS really good content. But grrr, why is it so hard to find a high quality geography workbook for kids this age?
customer_reviews.author: acs2104

customer_reviews.title: I'm Going to Use it Again
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this with a pre-k student and I like it. Some of the concepts are above her head but I like the way the various topics are introduced and the information covered. We've adapted and cover what she can comprehend. Once we complete the book, I'm going to reorder and go through it again to reinforce what she's already learned and to build upon that knowledge. The activities are well thought out and keep her interested but you need to copy certain pages because sometimes activities are listed on both sides of the same paper. Thus, if you cut and paste for one activity you cannot do the activity on the backside of the paper.
customer_reviews.author: KitDuluCa

customer_reviews.title: Maps and more
customer_reviews.text: This book is part of our kindergarten curriculum and each part has worked in with our hands on approach teaching directions, about compasses, bodies of land, etc. this also came with two good sized pull-out maps that we laminated for just a few dollars so we would have them for years to come. Awesome buy and great for kids K-2 grades.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki Frank

customer_reviews.title: good book
customer_reviews.text: Good intro to geography and mapping. It is targeted for K-2 and I felt that the level of difficulty varied widely from page to page. I skipped several pages at a time in a few sections, but plan to pick them up at the end of the year. Over all, a fun intro to maps, etc. I did not find it to be a hindrance to make copies of the pages where you need both front and back for the cutting/gluing activities. On the one hand, its nice to have a reproducible page, on the other hand, it would be really easy for the publisher to just print those pages separately-not front to back.
customer_reviews.author: BooksAreNerdy

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, poor layout
customer_reviews.text: We love the book, but the layout is poorly planned. They have you cut out pictures on one side of the page and expect you to glue them onto a grid, etc on the other side of the same page. They are front and back of the same page .... So when you cut out the pictures on one side you have also cut up the grid on the other side. Unless you plan to spend a lot of time making copies of the pages the layout just doesn't work. Otherwise the content is great and my 6 year old likes doing the book.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Helped my Grandson!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this so long ago that I had forgotten about it. My grand son was in kindergarten when I bought it--it's actually for second graders. By the time spring came around and he could read fairly well, he loved this. Mid-first grade, he was completely through it and had a blast! More importantly, we had a blast together. In third grade, he told me about learning about geography and maps and how much he had remembered from this book. It seemed to make life easier for him, and he was really pleased about that.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for homeschooling 1st grader
customer_reviews.text: These are very well presented lessons. They are clear, simple, easy to understand, and follow. It seems like the perfect pace for a 1st grader to complete in 1 year if you are doing 2 lessons a week. You can expand upon the lessons quite easily, and spread the curriculum out into 2nd grade as well if you want more depth, and more readings brought in. I purchased the National Geographic beginners atlas and we have a solid curriculum for the year.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Good introduction to geographical terms
customer_reviews.text: The pages are easily copied which makes it a re-usable text book and the lessons introduce simple map concepts and geographical vocabulary in a way kids understand. I'm using it for my daughter in kindergarten and this is one subject she actually asks to do because there is usually some coloring or cut and paste activities involved. The "test" or "review" sections have different levels so you can pick one suitable for your child's grade.
customer_reviews.author: HLGStrider

customer_reviews.title: Nice variety, laid out well
customer_reviews.text: This book will be part of our homeschool Kindergarten curriculum next year. Without wanting to guild the lily by buying a huge curriculum given our concentration on reading and math in Kindergarten, I did need a little bit of a framework to use as a jumping off point for our geography studies next year. This book will do just that. It is laid out in a systematic manner with lots of activities and ideas, but will also let the user add and expand upon the ideas without interfering to much. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Maty

customer_reviews.title: Daughters favorite summer workbook
customer_reviews.text: I bought a few books with different subject matter for downtime in the summer months before she enters 1st grade. This book by far is her favorite. She finds it interesting and looks forward to doing the lessons which includes: what is a map, directions & compass rose, map symbols and keys, landforms, continents & oceans.... I actually have fun doing these lessons with her!
customer_reviews.author: bellasmama

customer_reviews.title: Using this for part of our Kinder curriculum
customer_reviews.text: I found this workbook through another site that came highly recommended and I was happy to find it on Amazon for a lower price and substantially lower shipping. We used it today for the first time and my 6 yo daughter loved it. It starts off simple and builds on knowledge. I can't wait to start putting together a few unit studies and incorporating the lessons into them. I would definitely recommend this to Kinder and above.
customer_reviews.author: TriciaC

customer_reviews.title: Great supplement for my homeschooled kiddos!
customer_reviews.text: I homeschool my kindergartener and second grader. This is not a difficult curriculum by any means which is fine. They can do it together. My younger child isn't reading yet so I help him. I do feel like it's a gentle intro to Geography. We travel a lot so I think this is beneficial. We are doing a big road trip this summer and I hope to get some "help" by getting them to read maps along the way.
customer_reviews.author: E. Grolemund

customer_reviews.title: Great - but....
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old really enjoyed this book. I wasn't sure he was actually learning anything but at the end we pulled out the unlabeled maps and he was able to accurately label almost all the parts they listed. HOWEVER - there were at least a handful of pages that were impossible to do without a copier. I can appreciate that the pages were easy to pull out in case you wanted to copy them but I don't like *having* to make copies in order to do the sheets. That being said though, if they had the next level up for this, I would have gotten it.
customer_reviews.author: Sorcha

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent workbook to teach your child beginning map skills. I homeschool a first grader and a second grader. I find that this beginning Geography book fills in the gaps that their curriculum leaves behind. Both kiddos love to color the pictures and the directions are easy for them to understand. The full color maps are a wonderful resource as well! They love to look at the maps and point things out to each other. I would definitely by this again. FYI, Evan Moor gives you a printing license in the front of the workbook, so you can copy the pages to reuse again and again! We have used this product for 6 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Mikisticky

customer_reviews.title: Great for little explorers
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is all about exploration. This workbook is perfect for her. We have had so much fun learning about maps, she's getting very good at reading them herself. I know that GPS is everywhere but I still think that it is important for a person to be able to find their way along with just a compass and a map.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Great for 1st grade homeschooler
customer_reviews.text: I am using this with my 1st grader. It is easy enough that she can read the directions for herself on most days. I am using this as "seatwork" to make sure I don't miss any concepts when we are discussing maps. We will continue to us use other Evan-Moor resources.
customer_reviews.author: H Latt

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: As described. Starts put easy and gets harder. Good book.
customer_reviews.author: Tesla

customer_reviews.title: Great starting point
customer_reviews.text: ABSOLUTELY A GREAT STARTING POINT for geography. I supplement some for my 2nd grader with harder material but this introduces and explains concepts well. I purchased this at full price and my analysis is fair and impartial.
customer_reviews.author: IndyIN

customer_reviews.title: Great learning tool
customer_reviews.text: Great way to introduce geography to young kids while keeping their attention throughout the lesson. I use this as a supplement to our first graders homeschool curr. and he enjoys it. Pretty thorough on teaching directions, maps, distance, landforms, sizes and so on.
customer_reviews.author: J. Von Krusze

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I use it for my 4-year old boy who is comfortable reading at beginner level 1. He loves it because it is quite hands-on. I use the first half for him this year and the second half for him when he become 5. We love Evan Moor's workbook on Geog and Science and History.
customer_reviews.author: B F

customer_reviews.title: Great beginning geography book!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this and use it with our 5 year old for home school. It starts out basic and familiar for young children and moves to more abstract ideas as the book progresses. Very useful!
customer_reviews.author: Joyful_Life

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for Young Learners!
customer_reviews.text: I love this Beginning Geo book for my young homeschoolers! I find many of the activities appropriate for a kinder level student. Those that are not are easily modified. This is an awesome supplement to our social studies program.
customer_reviews.author: Jab

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my 5 year old daughter's homeschool curriculum and so far, she's enjoying it. I personally feel it's great for Kindergarten, given my own daughter's pace.
customer_reviews.author: Niffy

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Resource!
customer_reviews.text: It's a compact version of Daily Geography, which I also own and love. Many interesting activities for the students. Very nice drawings/pictorials for kids to color and label.
customer_reviews.author: Trekkies in JT

customer_reviews.title: A must have!
customer_reviews.text: We homeschool, but even if I did not, I would purchase this book!! It has fun worksheets, great pull out maps, and is highly appealing to kids, my child happens to be 6.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan River

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: I love homeschooling my little bean, she's 4 and with the help of my many homeschool resources like this book. She is learning a great deal. The book arrived quickly, and in great shape.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Roman

customer_reviews.title: Great Social Studies activities
customer_reviews.text: Lessons are easy to explain and teach kids. It could work with kindergarten and first grade...possibly a little lower age and higher age depending on the kid
customer_reviews.author: Amy Herman

customer_reviews.title: Beginning Geography
customer_reviews.text: My special-needs son loved this book! Easy to understand concepts. The way they approach landforms, etc., is in an organized, non-chaotic manner.
customer_reviews.author: Renatta

customer_reviews.title: book
customer_reviews.text: great interactive lesson book for teaching basic map skills, land forms, water bodies, and basic street directions to small children
customer_reviews.author: k

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love this workbook. A lot of left to right, and following simple directions. Helps your kids to become spatially aware early on.
customer_reviews.author: Camille A

customer_reviews.title: Geography made easy
customer_reviews.text: Since we are home schooling we are always looking for education material that makes a hard subject easier, this book does that. It introduces reading maps in a simple fashion.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia King

customer_reviews.title: Beginning Geography
customer_reviews.text: This workbook is wonderful! It will be easy for our 6 year olds to use. The print is dark. It covers everything they need to learn; after seeing it they are very eager to start working in it. I would definitely recommend this workbook. We will be using it this year to introduce geography to our homeschooled grandchildren.
customer_reviews.author: lwoods

customer_reviews.title: Great Resource
customer_reviews.text: Just received this tonight and had a good look through it. I'm pleased as it is exactly what I was wanting, as far as the other reviews complaining about the layout of pages keep in mind this is meant to be reproducible and it not meant to be a student workbook.
customer_reviews.author: Sami J.

customer_reviews.title: I love it.
customer_reviews.text: my daughter actually likes working through this book, and of course I'm happy because while she enjoys coloring and playing with it, she's learning the foundations to understanding geography.
customer_reviews.author: Tina L.

customer_reviews.title: new to homeschool
customer_reviews.text: I have not started home school yet but this looks like it will be perfect for my 5 and 3 year old, can't wait to start!
customer_reviews.author: Erica Castro

customer_reviews.title: beginning geopgraphy, grades k-2
customer_reviews.text: We are new to homeschool. This is wonderful as a basic "jumping off point". We have been able to find lots of everyday ways to incorporate learning into material covered. The only draw back is that the 'cut and paste' pages are not blank on the back. I just photocopied them on our printer.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Bowling

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun, easy intro to some good basic learning.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Great Learning Tool!
customer_reviews.text: My son is in kindergarten and I supplement his learning after school at home. I find the activities in this book to be fun and engaging. My son is learning so much and is getting a jump start over his classmates.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Homeschooling
customer_reviews.text: Colorful activities that address a lot of skills that may not be covered in school either because of its not emphasized in the curriculum or because Geography is not taught at all.
customer_reviews.author: LaTonya Howard

customer_reviews.title: Homeschool mom approves!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this book. It is a little advanced for him since he is only in kindergarten, but he loves the challenge. I love how the pages have a very simple lesson to learn and it's very interactive. It's not a book that you just write in or read. You get to cut and color, which makes me a fan!
customer_reviews.author: msessions

customer_reviews.title: Great workbook!
customer_reviews.text: This workbook has appropriate pages that has helped our K thru 4th graders, based on their individual skill levels. I recommend this workbook!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Storey

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this for my 5 year old homeschooled son. I am looking at more products by evan-moor because this is so easy to use and directions are clear unlike many workbooks.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Great Intro to Geography for the Very Young
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year-old son enjoyed working with this book. He reads and writes, so we used the book as independent study. Since we have done decent amount of worldly travel, played with Geo Puzzles for many years and now enjoy the Google Earth Program, we found the book a good balance between learning new concepts and reviewing old ones. Map Skills along with Landforms & Bodies of Water have introduced new vocabulary. The Continents and Oceans were a review. We recommend the book to the very young ones who enjoy learning.
customer_reviews.author: Jana

customer_reviews.title: My Geography Review
customer_reviews.text: This book goes hand in hand with the previous geography book I rated. I wouldnt buy one without the other. If your loikibg for a good book to teach your children geography these are the books to get.
customer_reviews.author: laura coker

customer_reviews.title: wonderful book for kids just starting to learn about geography.
customer_reviews.text: My kids love it. Starts off very simple so young children can grasp the concepts. Love it! I will definitely recommend this as a supplement to traditional school and home school.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exciting Book
customer_reviews.text: After looking through this book I was so happy to find everything I needed for Maps in one place. Have been sharing with other teachers and hoping they will make a purchase too.
customer_reviews.author: Salehah ABd al Khaliq

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My 1st grader and I are really enjoying this program so far!!
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this book. I'm glad we purchased it. She has used it every day by choice and I have to make her stop after 3 pages. She is only 5 but picking up skills quick.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Love this book for lower level special education to teach basic concepts
customer_reviews.text: My associates and I really like this book and it's been super helpful to teach kids basic geographic concepts. If I were to share any issues, I just wish there were more examples for each concept.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Johnston

customer_reviews.title: it says beginning Geography grades K-2 but its more like preschool or kindergarten at best- I was hoping it'd ...
customer_reviews.text: VERY BEGINNER. Yes, it says beginning Geography grades K-2 but its more like preschool or kindergarten at best- I was hoping it'd have some material in there for 1st to 2nd Grade levels but its way too basic. It should be marked for preschoolers, not up to 2nd grade.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great !!!
customer_reviews.text: I am using this for my homeschooled boys. It keeps the lessons simple and to the point. This is much better than textbook style geography because the lessons are short and "enjoyable". This is a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: ChrissyUSA

customer_reviews.title: I loved it
customer_reviews.text: i was looking for one book to introduce geography to my son and found this and it is just what i want.
customer_reviews.author: Dhamodaran S

customer_reviews.title: Geography is now my 6yo's favorite subject
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is a kinder who is working a grade level ahead, and we've recently switched her to homeschooling. She absolutely loves this workbook. She works in it every chance she gets and has learned a good amount so far. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: A. Scull

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Resource
customer_reviews.text: I am using this workbook as part of my 4-year-old son's homeschooling curriculum. I taught Kindergarten for two years before getting pregnant and staying home, and this workbook is as good as - if not better than - the geography resources I was using to teach Kindergarden. I bought this workbook along with the Kid's Atlas (purchased separately), but we haven't used the altas yet. I don't think we'll need it for another year or two. I highly recommend this workbook for beginning social studies!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a great book for teaching the basics of geography to little ones.
customer_reviews.author: Angelique M Snowberger

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this book. Geography has become a favorite subject in our home.
customer_reviews.author: lisa

customer_reviews.title: Good foundation.
customer_reviews.text: This book has 3 sections. It begins by teaching the basic map reading skills with recognizable pictures (bedroom) and teaches right and left and then moves on to directions. The book progresses to map keys, borders, grids etc and eventually ends with the continents. I have other geography workbooks and honestly, they are way too complicated than they need to be. Glad we started with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Amafala

customer_reviews.title: good book for young students
customer_reviews.text: I use this book with my first grade class. It is perfect for that level. However, Evan Moor has another product that I like even better called Daily Geography Lessons. They are sold by grade level. I use the 3d grade book with my 1st grade class and the kindergarten class uses the First Grade book. To me, this is fine for the normal first grade.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner Geography book
customer_reviews.text: I am using this for homeshcooling and I think it is a great book. My kids enjoy the worksheets are a learning a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: fun and educational
customer_reviews.text: This workbook is a fun way to approach the ideas of geography. Fun exercises. We're using it with our homeschool curriculum for my 4 and 6 y.o.s.
customer_reviews.author: A Customer

customer_reviews.title: Geography and Map basics!
customer_reviews.text: My first grade girl is using this as a supplement to her geography! It is fun and educational!
customer_reviews.author: michellel

customer_reviews.title: Part of Homeschool Curriculum
customer_reviews.text: We use this book as our Geography Homeschool Curriculum. Its easy, gets the job done, and best of all the kids like it.
customer_reviews.author: g in NC

customer_reviews.title: Love this book!
customer_reviews.text: Love how they integrated more than just geography in this book!! Simple yet they can learn lots from this book!
customer_reviews.author: crazy5

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: I like this book but I bought for my Kindergartner who is still learning to read. A lot of the lessons require that the child be able to read. My son still does the lessons but I have to be right there with him basically telling him the answers because the reading is more advanced for that age.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Windham

customer_reviews.title: Love it with one caveat
customer_reviews.text: We use this in our home school for my first grade daughter. The lessons are age appropriate and simple with fun activities. The only problem I have with this book is on many of the pages it instructs the child to color something in, cut it out and glue it on the next page. However, cutting it out will leave the next page riddled with holes and unusable so I'm not sure how they want the child to do this. Many of the lessons are not able to be completely finished because of this. Annoying and an easy fix for any book publisher. I'm not sure why they didn't catch this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Duffy

product_meta.title: Evan-Moor - 3727 Beginning Geography Book
product_meta.description: Evan-Moor beginning geography book. Build the foundations for geography literacy! Beginning geography makes it easy to introduce K 2 students to geography skills. Based on the national geography standards, the 93 reproducible practice pages cover beginning map skills, landforms and bodies of water, and continents and oceans. You'll love beginning geography because it introduces primary students to important geography concepts. Give your grade K 2 students the geography skills practice they need to successfully tackle the geography curriculum now and in the future. Features two full color fold out maps that support student's multiple skill levels. One poster is a simple world map that makes it easy for young students to understand beginning geography concepts. The other poster focuses on the landforms and bodies of water studied in each unit. Contains activities that easily fit into your curriculum. Because the activities don't need to be done sequentially, you can pick and choose activities that fit in with your curriculum. presents students with geography content vocabulary. Vocabulary introduced in each lesson helps students build the foundation they need to understand geography concepts now and in the future. Provides cumulative reviews that work as a formal assessment. Cumulative reviews at the end of each section help you gauge student's progress. Reviews range in difficulty and are presented in a variety of formats, including multiple choice, and work as a formal assessment of student's skill acquisition. Elementary-middle school grade.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
